div.div: ἐπ-αλλάσσω : only aor. part., ἐπαλλάξαντες, entwining in each other, connecting (the ends of the cord of war), i. e. prolonging the contest; others interpret, ‘drawing the cord of war now this way, now that,’ Il. 13.359†.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
